website_summaries.verdict: A good number of wearers commented that the Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX was a great running shoe. Aside from its structure and design, they admired the comfort it provided. Although several of them said that the upper section is stiff, others still recommended the shoe because of its quality. In general, the majority of the runners said that the Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX is the best choice for those who are looking for a comfortable and high-quality running shoe.
pros: According to several runners, they loved its top-quality construction
A few testers lauded the shoe's snug fit
A few testers said that the shoe was comfortable
Many buyers commented that the Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX is a great running shoe because of its excellent performance
A good number of purchasers admired its design
cons: Some runners said that the shoe has a narrow toe box
The upper area is stiffer when compared to previous models, according to one of the testers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes! Even great with heal bumps.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guy with pretty narrow feet so I sometimes buy women's running shoes. These shoes are seriously the best pair of running/walking shoes I've ever owned. Very comfortable with good arch support. I also have heel bumps (probably from growing up in hockey skates), also known as Haglund's deformity. It's not easy to find a comfortable pair of shoes with these goofy heal bumps, but these are absolutely perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Capt**Kirk

customer_reviews.title: 👍
customer_reviews.text: I went with the reviews and ordered a full size larger and hoped it wouldn’t be too big! They are perfect! I am not a runner and needed these for daily walks. I have been using their Wave Horizon and these are not as supportive or as cushioned, but they are equally as comfortable! Just returned from a couple mile walk, fresh out of the box, and I don’t want to take them off. And Goretex! I am set for colder temps and rain now. I’m very, very happy with this purchase😊
customer_reviews.author: WildHorseFreedom

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with these running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Went to try them on at a running shoe store first and they informed me to size up any shoe for running by one size -- I did it and they fit great! Have been wearing them for walking and running and these shoes never make my feet hurt, even after walking an entire day around Boston. Will take them on my summer vacation to Italy. As for the GoreTex, it works great. Wore them out on a rainy day with yoga pants and no umbrella and my feet stayed completely dry!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea G

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but a bit smaller than the standard Mizuno Wave Riders
customer_reviews.text: Overall a comfortable shoe but doesn't fit exactly like the regular Mizuno Wave Riders. I like that they are Gore Tex and feel like that alone makes them worth the purchase to keep for hiking and travel in wet places. Overall pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dannemiller

customer_reviews.title: water resistance
customer_reviews.text: GTX working is amazing! always had dry feet if run on the wet grass or in the rain. Would like more forefoot cushions.
customer_reviews.author: EJ

customer_reviews.title: Terrible. So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Can’t return now. I just took them out of the box the week to try not thinking they’d feel any different than my previous two pairs! They arch support is terrible. Not sure why they feel so bad vs the wave runner 21s i have had several pairs of. So disappointed and wish I had gotten the regular model.
customer_reviews.author: MLB

customer_reviews.title: Bulky
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Wave Rider since Wave Rider 18, I thought to give this one a try. The fit was different than the regular Wave Rider. This is bulky, doesn't feel as supported, and the padding around the ankle was very high and bulky. I returned the shoes since no one runs in uncomfortable shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Betty C

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and feet stay dry!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these shoes - comfy - maybe a bit tight in the toes so if you need a wide toe box these are not for you. I live in Seattle area and my feet stay dry and warm. Will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: MartyGee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfy shoes for walking
customer_reviews.text: Use these for walking my dog about 2 miles/day. Very comfortable, durable. Low profile, goes with all my jogger pants/shorts. I do have high arches and narrow feet.
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee44

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for winter
customer_reviews.text: I bought these right as winter was starting. My toes are usually icicles by the end of a run with the GTX my toes were toasty. I participated in a run a mile every day outside every day in January in Ohio even on single digit days had no problems. Little stiffer than usual Riders, but that's too be expected with GTX.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Hall

customer_reviews.title: A rare find, but a big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this shoe 3 stars because of the great look and materials. But the deal breaker here is the toe box. WAAY too narrow and tight. I think this Japanese company needs to go back to the drawing board on this one. Its a great shoe and with gore-tex, which is hard to find in running shoes. Plus its NAVY (yaay) and not loud ridiculous colors. But the fact that this shoe is pinched in the toe box making it 2 sizes too small, makes it a returned item. I had high hopes for this rare find, but was truly disappointed. -Mrs. Risen
customer_reviews.author: Peter Reisen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had many pairs of these shoes. Not sure why but they are much smaller and will be returned
customer_reviews.author: Robin Maier

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: I wear 8.5 and 9, depending on the brand. I purchased 8.5 - should have went 9.
customer_reviews.author: sokt

customer_reviews.title: Really Great Support
customer_reviews.text: They are a snug fit, wear athletic socks. support is top notch so my feet don't know what to do. They atent used to it! Using them mostly for indoor training. Really good buy, look forward to getting them outside!
customer_reviews.author: Blair Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe and look, but fits smaller than normal
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Wave Riders for about 10 years. This pair though was too small and narrow in the toe box so had to return and get a size bigger.
customer_reviews.author: MBo

customer_reviews.title: I think these shoes caused calf tearing....
customer_reviews.text: I don't know. Never had an issue before these shoes cause serious pain in my calf. Not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: BlandyPants

product_meta.title: Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX Women's Running Shoes
product_meta.description: Reliable cushioning with a responsive ride, the Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX is a neutral daily trainer that can handle any distance. Continuing to feature a springy CloudWave Plate as well as a U4icX heel wedge, the shoe provides a firmer cushioned feel with a slightly softer step in experience. A new premium sockliner further enhances step in comfort while an updated GTX upper offers water resistance. The same responsive ride with an enhanced on-foot experience, the Mizuno Wave Rider 21 GTX is built to keep your feet dry during your daily road miles.
feature_bullets: Mizuno Wave Technology for shock absorption and cushioning
Soft anatomical sock liner for extra arch support and cushioning
